explanations.unsupervised learning: The paper discusses the use of self-organizing feature maps (SOFM), which are a type of unsupervised learning algorithm, to analyze patent data.
explanations.clustering: The SOFM method is used to cluster patent data, reducing the amount of data by grouping similar patents together.
explanations.neural network: Self-organizing feature maps (SOFM) are a type of artificial neural network, specifically used for unsupervised learning tasks.
explanations.feature representation: The paper focuses on visualizing complex relationships among patents, which involves representing features of the patent data in a lower-dimensional space for better interpretation.
